# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Data

df = DataFrame(dt=[DateTime(2020, 5, 24), DateTime(2021, 1, 15), DateTime(2022, 12, 5)])
add_yearmonth(df)

Here is a Julia function that accomplishes this:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> year(x)*100 + month(x), df.dt)
    return df
end
```
This function takes a DataFrame `df` as input and adds a new column `ym` to it, where each value is the concatenation of the year and month from the corresponding date in `dt`. The `map` function applies this operation to every element in `df.dt`, and the `year` and `month` functions return the year and month components of the DateTime respectively.

You can use it like so:
```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

df = DataFrame(dt=[DateTime(2020, 5, 24), DateTime(2021, 1, 15), DateTime(2022, 12, 5)])
add_yearmonth(df)
```
This will return a new DataFrame with an additional column `ym` containing the desired values.
